item.title: The Evolving Role of the IT Auditor: Data Analytics, AI, and Future Skills | Arpna Aggarwal
item.description:
Learn all about how an IT Auditor uses data to solve the world's problems, one SOX control at a time.


In the latest episode of the Data Podcast for Nerds, we spoke with Arpna Aggarwal, a Senior IT Auditor specializing in data governance and compliance in the healthcare industry. Arpna shares her fascinating journey to becoming an IT audit expert, highlighting the critical intersection of data analytics and IT auditing.


Highlights üî¶

- Understanding and addressing AI ethics, data biases, and robust data governance frameworks are becoming increasingly crucial for auditors

- Leveraging data analytics tools like Alteryx and PowerBI can greatly enhance audit efficiency

- Experimenting with and comparing results from various GenAI tools can aid in research and creative tasks


Arpna reminds us that "Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world," as quoted by Nelson Mandela.


Where to find Arpna

LinkedIn

item.title: Level Up Your Data Skills: Using Open Source & Understanding Business Needs | Atanas Bosakov
item.description:
Learn all about how an open source advocate uses data to solve the world's problems, open source tool at a time.


In the latest episode of Data Podcast for Nerds! we talked with the amazing Atanas Bosakov to explore his fascinating journey into the world of data analytics.


Learn about his unconventional path that didn't start with computers or traditional quantitative fields, and how college economics classes ignited his passion for using data to answer questions.


Atanas is a big advocate for open source tools and shared his philosophy about using open source tools along with the best approaches to implementing them at an organization.


Highlights üî¶

- Leveraging open source tools for their practical benefits

- Promoting your data analytics work to showcase the full value you provide

- Committing to learning new tools and staying current in the dynamic data landscape to remain adaptable


Atanas also shared how playing video games taught him how to perform better when faced with a higher level of difficulty instead of giving up.


Tune in if you're ready to sharpen your skills and understand the real-world impact of data!


You can find Atanas on LinkedIn and Nostr, at Greeky npub1yhv3ql7svt2swhp75tgs9d8tl46tevw5yy44gnpq3c8gch872ysqjstq44


******

item.title: Leadership in Data: ICs, AI, & Community | Phoenix Jay
item.description:
Learn all about how a Community Leader uses data to solve the world's problems, one data conference at a time.


In the latest episode of Data Podcast for Nerds!, we talk with Phoenix, who shares an inspiring journey from studying statistics to becoming an analytics engineer. Phoenix offers fantastic insights perfect for anyone exploring a career in data, showing how to be a leader as an individual contributor.


We explore how unique past experiences are a superpower in data, how community helps you thrive, and some cool ways AI can actually be your learning buddy!


Highlights üî¶

- How to actively seek and provide feedback to build trust

- Engaging with data communities for support, technical skill development, and leadership growth

- Using AI tools strategically as a learning partner or interview preparation coach

- Uncovering the "why" behind data requests to build meaningful solutions


Leadership isn't just a title. You can be a leader as an individual contributor by taking initiative, setting expectations, documenting processes, and building relationships across teams.


Tune in to learn how you can also become a leader in the data space!


Where to find Phoenix

LinkedIn

Disruptive Data Leadership Summit


******

item.title: Blogging About Data Landed Me a Dream Job | Megan Bowers
item.description:
Learn all about how a Content Manager uses data to solve the world's problems, one blog post at a time.


This week on the Data Podcast for Nerds!, I talked to Megan Bowers, who pivoted into data analytics after realizing she loved working with data in Excel. She took a bootcamp, landed a role using Power BI and Alteryx, and started blogging about her journey - sharing tips, project insights, and lessons learned.


Some of her most popular blog posts:

‚úÖ "The Life of a Data Analyst" - series

‚úÖ "How Do You Know Your Analysis is 'Right'?"

‚úÖ "Data Science Concepts Explained to a Five-year-old"


That blog led to her current job at Alteryx where she gets to write all about analytics to help others navigate the field... AND... hosts the Alteryx podcast, Alter Everything.


We also talked about the various ways people have used Alteryx for fun personal projects. She mentioned a couple of her own projects, one involving Taylor Swift!


If you're into data, storytelling, and exploring fun analytics use cases, you won‚Äôt want to miss this episode.


Where to find Megan

LinkedIn, Medium, Alteryx Community, Alteryx Podcast

item.title: How to Become a Great Leader: It Starts with Self-Awareness | Aaron Wilkerson
item.description:
In the latest episode of Data Podcast for Nerds! we talked with Aaron Wilkerson about his path to leadership.


Key takeaways from our conversation:

- Self-awareness matters and clarity can earn respect

- Tech is just part of the puzzle and choosing the right tools matter

- Spreadsheets can be simple but extremely powerful!


Listen in for insights and real-world advice from a professional data nerd who figured out his path by focusing on what he really wanted (and what he didn‚Äôt).


If you're navigating your own career path or considering a pivot, this episode is for you.


Where to find Aaron

LinkedIn

item.title: The Secret to Great Storytelling: Capture Attention & Teach Something | David Cohen
item.description:
Learn all about how a professional storyteller uses data to solve the world's problems, one game show at a time.


We had an interesting conversation with David Cohen, who built a career in consulting and found a passion for using data storytelling to drive real strategic change. But it‚Äôs not just about building dashboards. At The end of the day it‚Äôs about creating conversations, shifting mindsets, and making data useful and engaging for the people who need it most!


üî¶ Highlights

- How human-centered design makes dashboards actually useful

- The balance between strategy (structured) and storytelling (creative)

- Why collaboration (not assumptions) leads to better insights

- How failure teaches resilience and iteration


Oh, and did I mention David is also designing a game show to make data storytelling fun!?


If you're passionate about making data more engaging and actionable, you won‚Äôt want to miss this conversation.


Where to find David

item.title: Beyond the Resume: How to Stand Out & Succeed in Cybersecurity | Rob Whetstine
item.description:
Learn all about how a Cybersecurity Leader uses data to solve the world's problems, one hack at a time.


What happens when a curious kid starts pulling computers out of the trash, takes them apart, and falls headfirst into the hacking scene?

Turns out, you can turn that curiosity into a 20+ year career in tech!


In the latest episode of Data Podcast for Nerds, we got to talk with Rob Whetstine. He gave us a view into how security overlaps with the data space and shared some incredibly helpful career tips.


Highlights üî¶

- Hiring insights for neurospicy minds, why deep technical Qs might not be the best approach

- How to calm your nerves during an interview

- What to do immediately after you make a mistake


Plus, we geek out over 3D printing (because it's the closest thing to a Star Trek replicator), favorite movies, games, and weirdest security problems.


If you love problem-solving, security, or just nerdy conversations, this one‚Äôs for you!

item.title: Why Starting Outside of Data Makes You a Better Data Professional | Tris Burns
item.description:
Learn all about how a data leadership coach uses data to solve the world's problems, one pizza at a time.


The latest episode of Data Podcast for Nerds, we talk with Tris Burns, who started in oil & gas as a business analyst, discovered the power of data, and morphed into a data analyst.


Along the way, he worked in banking, scaled data teams at Pizza Hut, and now helps data leaders maximize the potential of their careers.


Highlights üî¶

- The evolving roles of Business Analyst vs. Data Analyst

- Why starting outside of data can make you a stronger data professional

- The trap of promoting ICs to leadership without preparation‚Äîand how to fix it

- Why data governance & data quality are the smart career moves in today‚Äôs AI-driven world


If you‚Äôre looking to break into data (or grow as a leader in the space), this episode is packed with insights you don‚Äôt want to miss! üéß

item.title: Digital Literacy, Power Query, and Excel: The Tools That Transform Careers | Robin Hunt
item.description:
Learn all about how a data junkie uses data to solve the world's problems, one Power Query at a time.


The latest episode of Data Podcast for Nerds, we talk with Robin Hunt who shares with us an inspiring story of how she went from teaching Microsoft Outlook and Windows 95 to running her very own company, ThinkData, building groundbreaking training software and shaping national standards for data analytics!


Highlights üî¶

- ThinkData's Apprenticeship Program

- CompTIA Data+ Certification

- Best Excel Functions


The main takeaway for us here is to be bold! If you've ever thought about maybe wanting to get into data, you should explore it!!

item.title: Why Consulting Might Be the Best Start for Data Professionals | Chris Moshier
item.description:
Learn all about how a data nerd uses data to solve the world's problems, one pizza topping at a time.


This week, I had the pleasure of chatting with Chris, a map nerd turned analytics pro whose journey through GIS, consulting, and public sector tech is nothing short of inspiring.


Highlights:

- How to work with spatial data

- Finding needles in haystacks

- Focusing on Scott Taylor's moto, 'Truth, before meaning'


This is the first official episode of Season 3 and we are putting a new spin on the nerdy Fun Bits ü§ì


We went with a speed round this time to highlight how much of a nerd Chris is outside of work. Topics included pizza, running, traveling, music, being a dad, and taking personality tests!

item.description:
Happy New Year!!


Data Podcast for Nerds! brings you a very special episode, which is now a yearly tradition...


In this episode, my dear friend Ramona C. Truta, M.Sc. joins the show to recap Season 2 and the random awesomeness that occurred for nerdnourishment in 2024.

We talk about a very important topic of why adaptability is one of the best skills for a data professional

item.title: The Accountant Data Analyst: Confidence, Curiosity, and SQL Mastery | Fabrice Joseph
item.description:
Have you ever heard of the Accountant Data Analyst?? If not, you'll definitely want to check out the latest episode of the Data Podcast for Nerds!


We talked with Fabrice to learn about how his career in management accounting, which he calls the "Accountant Data Analyst"


Fabrice enjoys the combination of data engineering, insights generation, and deep business performance analysis.


Highlights

üåü The unexpected confidence you can gain from seemingly unrelated experiences.

üåü How curiosity is the ultimate skill for career transitions‚Äîand why you already have it.

üåü Why learning styles matter when picking up new technical skills.


If you're on a journey to break into data, or just need a reminder to stay curious, this episode will inspire you to think differently about your skills and your path.


Where to find Fabrice: LinkedIn

item.title: Cause-Driven Careers: Using Data to Make a Difference | Michelle Dunivan, PhD
item.description:
Learn all about how an animal welfare insights expert uses data to solve the world's problems, one dog bark at a time.


In this episode, Michelle shares how she turned her love for research and statistics into a fulfilling career.


Michelle says that cause-driven work will always be at the heart of what she does.


Highlights üî¶

- The scientific method applies everywhere: Start with a question, be specific, and gather only the data you need.

- Communication is key: Knowing how to adjust for different audiences‚Äîfrom executives to volunteers‚Äîcan make or break collaboration.

- Leadership Is More Than a Title: It‚Äôs about influence, understanding team dynamics, and being a catalyst for growth and innovation in your organization.


My favorite part about this episode was learning a new phrase for "Garbage In, Garbage Out".

You'll have to tune in to learn it yourself!!


Where to find Michelle: LinkedIn

item.description:
Learn all about how a board game connoisseur uses data to solve the world's problems, one game piece at a time.


Ever feel stuck in the daily grind, pulling data into Excel, running manual processes, and thinking, ‚ÄúThere has to be a better way‚Äù?


We had an extremely fun discussion with Blake around how he created his own business by teaching himself how to automate everything.


What made this the most fun episode was talking about strategic thinking by diving into the world of board games.


Highlights üî¶

- Learning by doing

- Generative AI

- Strategy


Whether you're looking to automate your daily tasks, leverage your data for insights, or just need new board game recommendation, this conversation is packed with inspiration and tips.

item.title: How I Went from Data Entry to Healthcare Analyst with Just One SQL Query! | Thais Cooke
item.description:
Learn all about how a healthcare analyst uses data to solve the world's problems, one workflow at a time.


Ever wonder how a dental lab, a love for SQL, and a white noise machine can transform a career?


In this episode, we got to talk with Thais Cooke about how leveraged her healthcare experience to turn herself into a data analyst on the spot!


One Google search for "how to analyze data" later, and she discovered a whole new career path. Immediately after she wrote her first "SELECT *", she fell in love with SQL.


She loves SQL and healthcare so much, she even has a LinkedIn Learning course!

'SQL for Healthcare Professionals'


Highlights üî¶

- How to leverage your strengths to become a data analyst

- The importance of refining your job search - titles are the key

- What to say and (more importantly) NOT to say during a job interview


Don't tune in unless you're ready to be inspired!

item.title: Why Should Auditors Be Using Analytics
item.description:
This deep dive overview and description was created using NotebookLM, using the new Global Internal Audit Standards published January 9, 2024.


This in-depth look at Standard 10.3 will be valuable for internal audit professionals, chief audit executives, and anyone interested in the role of technology in modern internal auditing.


This overview provides a comprehensive overview of Standard 10.3, Technological Resources, from the new Global Internal Audit Standards. The overview explores the requirements for internal audit functions to utilize technology in their work, as well as the chief audit executive's responsibility to assess and pursue technological enhancements.


Learn about the key considerations for implementing Standard 10.3, such as assessing the feasibility of new technologies, collaborating with other departments on shared systems, and securing funding for technology upgrades. The overview also examines examples of evidence that demonstrate conformance with the standard.


******

item.title: Career Insights from a Digital Nomad | Jordan Goldmeier
item.description:
Learn all about how a digital nomad uses data to solve the world's problems, one spreadsheet at a time.


If you're curious what life is like as a digital nomad, check out this episode!


We got to chat with Jordan, who has been curious about how to tell computers what to do since age 8.


His early love for programming led him to merge his background in business and coding to create powerful Excel workflows that streamline processes for clients.


He even admits that many of his best ideas came to him in his dreams, talk about true dedication!


Highlights ‚ö°

- How to build tools in your sleep

- Different ways to run a business as a digital nomad

- Advice on building a successful life with the skills you already have


Jordan‚Äôs energy and insights are inspiring üí°


Tune in to learn how to take your Excel skills to the next level and start creating a life of your own design!

item.title: Nurse Turned Data Expert: Creative Problem-Solving in Healthcare | Joe Squire
item.description:
Learn all about how a former nurse uses data to solve the world's problems, one clinical outcome at a time.


Have you ever thought about how many modalities of data exist in the healthcare industry?


Joe stumbled into the world of data while working as a nurse.


He talked about how he was able to explore these different types of data like written notes, voice recordings, and images to solve the most interesting problems you find in healthcare.


Highlights

- Handling healthcare data (PHI)

- Building a portfolio to a promotion

- Practicing for interviews and presentations

- Data professionals are more create thank you might think


We also played a game to determine if we were Right Brain or Left Brain.


Play along and share your results!

item.description:
Ever thought about how data can impact decisions in HR? In our latest episode, we talk with Dr. Serena Huang about her unique career journey, lessons learned from experimenting with data, and how she's on a mission to educate the world about data and AI!

- What is People Analytics and how it's changing talent decisions

- What skills hiring managers are looking for in data analyst and data scientist candidates

- How to increase your business acumen skills

item.title: Data Science, MLOps and LLMs: Pioneering the Future of AI | Matt Sharp
item.description:
Learn all about how a Data Pioneer uses data to solve the world's problems, one data problem at a time.


Imagine walking into your office, decked out in a bunny suit, watching robots running everywhere. Talk about working in the future!!


Matt started his career as a chemical engineer and considers himself to be a data pioneer, always finding new and innovative ways to solve problems that have a real-world impact.


He became fascinated with MLOps and the future of AI with LLMs. His goal is to make complex concepts easier to understand which he has done with his new book, LLMs in Production!


Highlights from the episode:

- Making the shift from chemical engineer, to data science, to MLOps

- Laying the groundwork for others to follow and thrive in the field of data

- Understanding the importance of a robust education system


Don‚Äôt miss this episode if you‚Äôre curious about the future of AI, MLOps, and how to pioneer your own path into data science!

item.itunes:summary:
Learn all about how a Data Pioneer uses data to solve the world's problems, one data problem at a time.


Imagine walking into your office, decked out in a bunny suit, watching robots running everywhere. Talk about working in the future!!


Matt started his career as a chemical engineer and considers himself to be a data pioneer, always finding new and innovative ways to solve problems that have a real-world impact.


He became fascinated with MLOps and the future of AI with LLMs. His goal is to make complex concepts easier to understand which he has done with his new book, LLMs in Production!


Highlights from the episode:

- Making the shift from chemical engineer, to data science, to MLOps

- Laying the groundwork for others to follow and thrive in the field of data

- Understanding the importance of a robust education system


Don‚Äôt miss this episode if you‚Äôre curious about the future of AI, MLOps, and how to pioneer your own path into data science!

item.title: How Documenting My Learning Journey Got Me a Job in DevRel | Cole Freeman
item.description:
Learn all about how an ex Cop uses data to solve the world's problems, one LinkedIn post at a time.


If you're curious if sharing your learning journey is worth it... you should check out this episode!


Cole started his career in law enforcement and then accidently fell into the world of data analytics after having to take over for someone while in a consulting role. After learning all about Excel and PowerBI, he got the itch for becoming even more technical.


This sent him on a path to learning about a tool called Mage. While he was documenting his learning journey on LinkedIn to hold himself accountable, Mage reached out to him with a job in DevlRel!!


So, if you're curious if sharing your learning journey is worth it... the answer is yes!


More Highlights

- Why learning DAX might be easier than learning Excel

- The importance of communication skills in data

- The power of documentation!


Whether you're transitioning into data analytics or looking to refine your skills, this episode offers practical insights and inspiration!

item.description:
Learn all about how the Founder of The Data Freelance uses data to solve the world's problems, one data project at a time.


If you're curious about freelancing in the data space and want to lean how to get clients, check this out!


Dimitri is the founder of The Data Freelance, wrote a book, and loves to help out the data community. He tells us his story of how he transitioned from a job he didn't like very much... and became a successful freelancer.


Highlights

- How casinos use customer behavior for safety purposes

- The most intersting marketing problems to solve

- Tips on getting clients as a freelancer


Tune in to hear more about how you can become more dangerous with data, find your passion, and stay motivated.

item.title: Leveraging Data to Enhance Every Job | Eric Sims
item.description:
Learn all about how a Data Scientist uses data to solve the world's problems, one side project at a time.


Ever wondered how data can transform every role you have, whether that be in academia, government, health, or even utilities?


Eric LOVES side projects! He mentions this multiple times throughout this episode while also sharing how you can find data projects in your current job.


Highlights

- Using Salesforce data to create a dashboard

- Using process data to make manual processes easier and faster

- Using ChatGPT to suggest data projects tailored to your current job

- Creating fun side projects like a ukulele tuner, DeskFit app, and even a cat-detecting sprinkler system!


Don't miss out on learning how to leverage data in any role, find small impactful projects, and keep the fun in your work without burning out!

item.title: Boost Your Data Skills with Mock Data Sets: Lessons from the Google Sheets Fanboy | Larry Lathrop
item.description:
Learn all about how a Freelancer uses data to solve the world's problems, one zombie dataset at a time.


In the world of data analytics, finding innovative ways to keep your skills sharp and your projects engaging can be a challenge. Larry shares with us a refreshingly unique approach...


Creating fake data sets! But wait, there's more...


These fake data sets are themed around a fictional zombie company called "Bite-SiZe Munchies".


This fun and creative method not only makes data more engaging but also helps solve real-world problems.


Highlights

- Practical applications of mock data

- How to make data accessible and easy to understand

- How to become and succeed as a Freelancer in the data space


Listen in for all the tips Larry shares on how to make your data #ZombieEasy and #ZombieProof

item.title: LinkedIn Learning Instructors Talk about Data | Monica Kay Royal & Lily Zheng
item.description:
In this very special episode of latest episode of the Data Podcast for Nerds! Live from the LinkedIn Learning office, two LinkedIn Learning Instructors talk all about the 'fun' parts of data. There's a delicate balance between collecting enough data for your analysis, but not too much where you violate people's confidentiality. But sometimes you have to collect personal and sensitive data. Especially if you are in the same line of work as Lily and conducting demographic analyses. In these cases, it's all about helping businesses make better equity decisions in the workplace while also protecting the data of individuals. Highlights: - Qualitative vs. Quantitative analytics - How discrimination sneaks into the workplace - Accounting for bias in machine learning models - How the human behavior system is involved in it all! Join this very special live episode as we explore the overlap of data security and DEI.

Our Courses

Protecting Data for Analysis and Machine Learning

A Playbook to Achieve Equity Anywhere

Where to find Lily LinkedIn

item.title: Secrets for Helping You Find the Best Data Job | Marijn Markus
item.description:
Learn all about how a Social Scientist uses data to solve the world's problems, one cup of coffee at a time. If you're able to forget about having to be perfect, you'll be surprised at how easy it is to talk about your passions and showing your credibility. Marijn shares with us all the best kept trade secrets in the data industry! Did you know that there is a correlation between coffee and data jobs? Other Highlights: - Learning about how you can apply random skills like RPA Orchestration and 3D printing for building home projects. - Getting philosophical about why you don't have to be a unicorn to get into data, you actually wanna be a pony. - Reviewing the Big Mac index and how the price of a Big Mac can be used for forecasting purposes.

and my favorite part was nerding out a bit on GDPR, data privacy, and things to consider when building your models. Join us to learn more about these best kept trade secrets to help you find the best data job! Where to find Marijn LinkedIn

item.dc:creator: nerdnourishment
item.itunes:summary:
Learn all about how a Social Scientist uses data to solve the world's problems, one cup of coffee at a time. If you're able to forget about having to be perfect, you'll be surprised at how easy it is to talk about your passions and showing your credibility. Marijn shares with us all the best kept trade secrets in the data industry! Did you know that there is a correlation between coffee and data jobs? Other Highlights: - Learning about how you can apply random skills like RPA Orchestration and 3D printing for building home projects. - Getting philosophical about why you don't have to be a unicorn to get into data, you actually wanna be a pony. - Reviewing the Big Mac index and how the price of a Big Mac can be used for forecasting purposes.

and my favorite part was nerding out a bit on GDPR, data privacy, and things to consider when building your models. Join us to learn more about these best kept trade secrets to help you find the best data job! Where to find Marijn LinkedIn

item.title: How to Switch Careers | Becoming a Data Analyst | Mikiko Bazeley
item.description:
Learn all about how a MLOps & AI Engineer uses data to solve the world's problems, one GenAI tool at a time. Two things to learn about the data field if you are new in your career: the details always matter and people are more impressed with your grit than your grind. In this episode, Mikiko shares with us her story on how she transitioned into data analytics from her job working at a hair salon! Highlights üî¶ - How to transition into data from a completely different industry - The importance of applying what you learn in courses by building projects - How to use generative AI tools to help you save tons of hours Tune in to hear Mikiko share a whole lotta resources to help you along your career journey! item.title: Exploring the Deep End of Artificial Intelligence | Harpreet Sahota
item.description:
Learn all about how a Hacker in Residence uses data to solve the world's problems, one model at a time. The hard truth about our wonderful world of data, nobody understands what deep learning is or how it works!


In this episode, Harpreet shares with us what he does at Voxel51 as a Hacker in Residence along with some great tips about the deep end of artificial intelligence.


Highlights üî¶

- Developer Advocacy / Hacker in Residence

- The best approach to reading a research article

- Breakdown of modern roles from research scientist / research engineer / deep learning engineer / AI engineer


Join us to learn about the various experiences Harpreet has accumulated during his career including teaching high school math, working as an actuary, pivoting to biostatistician, and hacking the developer advocacy space.


Where to find Harpreet

LinkedIn


LinkedIn Learning Courses

Computer Vision for Data Scientists

Prompt Engineering with LangChain

More to come...

item.title: Podcasting Perspectives: How to Achieve Excellence | Ken Jee
item.description:
Learn all about how this exponential podcast host uses data to solve the world's problems, one athlete interview at a time.


Ken's journey with podcasting has been one of the most impactful things he's done in his entire life and most recently set an ambitious goal to embark on the most complete study of excellence in sports ever created.


In this episode, we are covering all the bases from unraveling the secrets of podcasting to sharing insights on the IKEA furniture assembly conundrum.


Highlights üî¶

- Using podcasting as a means for professional and personal growth

- Origin story to Ken's new podcast > The Exponential Athlete

- Discussion around problem-solving frameworks


Join us to discover how the intersection of athleticism, analytics, podcasting, and self-improvement can shape your path to success!

item.title: How to Become the Best at Anything: The Ultimate Quest | Josh Starmer
item.description:
If your currently interested in learning a particular topic, say statistics, you MUST check out this episode. It's WAY more than just learning a topic, it's about HOW you are learning it!


Josh created his YouTube Channel, StatQuest, as a way to publicly share his quest of learning more about statistics, machine learning, and AI


I have learned so much from his way of teaching. He doesn't dumb down the material, he builds up your understanding so that you are smarter.


It was an absolute pleasure to get to talk with him üòÄ


OF COURSE, I had to ask him to share all the origin stories!


üèÅ How he started his channel

ü™ï Where his theme songs come from

üí• Who / What inspired his famous BAM!


Join us to learn all about these origin stories along with the power of visual learning and building in public. It's literally the BEST way to learn ü§ì

item.title: Navigating Career Transitions into Data | Lauren Rosenthal
item.description:
Learn all about how a Customer Success & Analytics Specialist uses data to solve the world's problems, one fiction page at a time.


Do you believe in being in the right place at the right time?


Lauren made her way from healthcare into the data world and her biggest advice is that if you have an opportunity in front of you, TAKE IT!


There isn't a linear path into data. There isn't even a linear path once you're working in data.


One thing that was clear to Lauren, life as a data professional is a lot like the healthcare industry in that you get to help others üòÄ


Lauren's favorite resources to learn new things

- Books

- Podcasts

- Maven (of course)


Join us to learn about the non-linear paths you can take, and the amazing opportunities that you can unlock if you take the jump!


Where to find Lauren: LinkedIn

item.title: How to Turn Passion into Profession - Networking, Learning, and Leveraging Experiences | Alex Merced
item.description:
Learn all about how a Developer Advocate uses data to solve the world's problems, one programming language at a time.


If you think that you have too much of a random background to break into data, you gotta listen to Alex's origin story! He has done basically everything under the sun before officially getting his dream data job with Dremio.


Alex went from playing video games, practicing as a rockstar, owning a hobby store, learning just about every programming language out there, and everything in between.


Quote: "I'm happy with the story I've had, but I'm always glad to continue making the story more fun"


Highlights ‚ú®

- How to level up your skills when you're grounded

- Starting several business, all through networking

- Using content creation as a means for learning


Alex already gave his warning, join us for the ride, this episode is jam packed full of fun!

item.title: How to Show Off Your Skills - Start With Your Resume | Jack Blandin
item.description:
Learn all about how a Specialized Technical Recruiter uses data to solve the world's problems, one baseball card statistic at a time.


If you are one of many data job seekers out there that are stumped at how to solve the chicken and egg problem, check out this episode!


Jack is currently building out a platform to help businesses build data teams by allowing candidates to show off their skills.


I think I gave Jack a lightbulb moment by pointing out that his interest in baseball card statistics and IMDB movie pages could tie into his recruiting platform! I hope I convinced him of a new way people should structure their resumes ü§ì


At the end of the day, if you have your mind set on achieving a goal, never stop trying!


Where to find Jack: LinkedIn

item.itunes:summary:
Learn all about how a Specialized Technical Recruiter uses data to solve the world's problems, one baseball card statistic at a time.


If you are one of many data job seekers out there that are stumped at how to solve the chicken and egg problem, check out this episode!


Jack is currently building out a platform to help businesses build data teams by allowing candidates to show off their skills.


I think I gave Jack a lightbulb moment by pointing out that his interest in baseball card statistics and IMDB movie pages could tie into his recruiting platform! I hope I convinced him of a new way people should structure their resumes ü§ì

item.title: Ace the Data Science Interview with your Project Portfolio AND MORE! | Nick Singh
item.description:
Learn all about how a Chief Lemur Officer uses data to solve the world's problems, predicting one hip hop track at a time. If you are one of many that aren't sure what types of projects you should have in your project portfolio, you NEED to check out this episode.

Warning, it's very meta... on multiple levels!! ‚ö†Ô∏è


Nick spends most of his time these days writing SQL queries on his own data to understand how users are interacting with his website... which helps others learn to write SQL queries. FULL CIRCLE!


The fact that Nick went from entertaining hip hop nerds to a entertaining data nerds is a story you don't want to miss out on


Highlights:

- Leveraging your passions to build data products

- Building project portfolios that have more than one purpose

- Focusing on the right way to solve problems during an interview


Oh yea, and Nick used to work for Facebook... META!!! ü§ì

item.title: Exploring the Data Side of Corporate Communications | Elise Woodard
item.description:
If you have ever wondered how companies use social media effectively to market their products, we get an inside look into tech marketing with Elise on our latest episode of the Data Podcast for Nerds!


Highlights ‚ú®

- Social media posts get more interaction during the weekdays (not too much of a surprise)

- The weekends are for fun and social media posts can follow that trend, even for tech companies!

- ELI5 takes on a new meaning


Bonus

Both Elise and I have a dance background and nerd out a bit on how dancing and data are exactly the same! üëØ


Join us if you are curious about the overlap of social media, marketing, and data. This one is jam packed full of edutainment!

item.title: Busting the Myths of Interviews from a Hiring Manager | Lindsay Murphy
item.description:
If you have ever wondered what hiring managers are actually looking for when hiring candidates, we bust some myths with Lindsay on this very topic on the latest episode of the Data Podcast for Nerds!


We explore üîé

- The soft skills that you should highlight during the interview to set you above the rest

- The approach to take when learning how to solve problems AND how to share that during an interview

- Lindsay's favorite questions to ask her interviewees and how to answer them


Join us if you are preparing for your data interview, and also if you are curious to learn which music is the best background music to rock out and do some code.

item.title: How to use Gamification to your Advantage at Work | Tom Hinkle
item.description:
You've probably heard the term 'gamification' before, but did you know that you can use it to your advantage at work? On the latest episode of the Data Podcast for Nerds, we talk with Tom and nerd out on how your desire for winning makes you a better problem solver.


Fun Facts:

üéÆ Gamification was a term coined in 2003

üïπÔ∏è According to a 2023 Tech Report Survey, 90% of employees admit to being more productive if gamification is involved in their work


Tune in to discover:

- The role of gamification in fostering creativity and innovation

- How gamification principles can be integrated with behavior design techniques to boost engagement around training efforts like security awareness

- Real-life examples and success stories of individuals and organizations leveraging gamification effectively


Join us and unlock the game-changing secrets to unlocking creativity, productivity, and success in the modern workplace.


******

item.title: Unveiling Marathon Training Secrets for Career Growth | Gaurav Tiwari
item.description:
Ever wondered about the parallels between training for a marathon and honing your skills for a data career? In our latest episode of the Data Podcast for Nerds, we talk with Gaurav and dive deep into this intriguing comparison!


Tune in to discover:

ü§ù The importance of community and mentorship in achieving your objectives.

üîç Insights into the discipline and dedication required for both endeavors.

üìà Strategies for goal-setting, progress tracking, and staying motivated.

üí° Practical tips for overcoming challenges and pushing your limits.


Whether you're a seasoned runner or a data enthusiast, this episode offers valuable perspectives that will leave you motivated, energized, and ready to conquer your goals!


Join us as we explore the relationship between physical endurance and professional growth, and unlock the secrets to success in both arenas!

item.title: Dominate Imposter Syndrome
item.description:
In this very special episode, my business coach, Katie McManus, and I talk about imposter syndrome.


You know that nagging feeling of inadequacy and self-doubt? It somehow always finds a way to interrupt you the moment you're on the verge of something big, like transitioning into a new career path.


This is a topic many of us can relate to and we often think that we need to overcome this so-called barrier. Let's actually explore trying to lean in and make Imposter Syndrome your friend!


******

item.title: Cybersecurity is a Great Career for Data Professionals | Nate Parkhurst
item.description:
Learn all about how a Cybersecurity Specialist uses data to solve the world's problems, one SOC at a time.


I love nerding out with cyber folks, the overlap of data and cyber is fascinating


Nate shares his story with working as a consultant and experience with working in a SOC (security operations center). I found it most interesting that you can now work remotely in a SOC environment.


If you're looking at fun and interesting data projects, Nate shares a few he's been working on in the cyber space. He also shares how he uses his data for personal projects like gardening. Who likes strawberries!? üçìüôãüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è


At the end of the day, data has a human element. It is critical that you pay attention to from the point of hiring all the way to offboarding. You want to make sure that everyone is properly trained and understands how to properly protect the data!



Resources

ISC2: https://www.isc2.org/Landing/1MCC

ISACA: https://www.isaca.org/

NVIDIA: https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/training/



Where to find Nate

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/nate-parkhurst/

item.title: What are the Responsibilities of a Data Professional | Anthony Santillanes
item.description:
It was really great chatting with Anthony and diving into the fun characteristics of data. He has a background in health and wellness and for fun, loves to track the productivity of his garden and chickens


People problems are his favorite, specifically those that are related to the psychology of the workplace. But in order to solve these types of problems, you need to combine different data sets which involves a lot of manual work.


A couple reality checks that Anthony shared were that data analytics has a humility aspect to it becuase you can't control everything. And also, we only change when things become painful enough and it is our responsibility as a data professional to highlight when a change is needed.

Where to find Anthony: LinkedIn

item.title: The Main Driver of Being a Successful Data Analyst | Timo Dechau
item.description:
Learn all about how an Event Data Wizard uses data to solve the world's problems, one event at a time.


If you were ever curious about how companies analyze their user's journey, listen in!


I had such a fun time nerding out on Event Data with Timo Dechau


Timo says that the magic of event data is the sequence you can analyze üîÆ


One crazy concept he shares is the power of talking with people


‚ûï


Having curiosity is the main driver of being a successful data professional


Although he does provide an interesting POV that curiosity is both good and bad... and after hearing him out, I can relate! ü§ì

item.title: The Success Formula for Breaking into Tech | Sadie St. Lawrence
item.description:
Learn all about how an AI Strategist uses data to solve the world's problems, one success formula at a time.


I had such a fun conversation with one of the most inspiring women in AI, Sadie St. Lawrence


We talked all about the success formula for breaking into tech


It is important to note that no one really starts from ground zero, if you are changing careers


Sadie believes that you probably have about half the skills you already need if you take the time to understand your skillsets


For example, everyone uses communication at their jobs, so that is your starting point üõ£Ô∏è


Throughout her amazing journey, Sadie realized that there was a disconnect between the business and tech folks


Lots of folks trying to fit square pegs into rounds holes üôÉ


So on her spare time, for fun, she likes to grab her pen and paper and jot out connections between obscure industries or topics


This hobby makes her the amazing AI Strategist she is today!


This episode is jam packed full of great advice


From skills to resumes to networking, even a little bit of time traveling ‚åõ


You won't want to miss out on this one!


******

item.title: How to Stand Out in Data Job Interviews from a Hiring Manager | Santona Tuli
item.description:
Santona has a fascinating background, her experience taught her how to tell stories about early universe physics and the world we are in today


She loves to solve problems that have not been solved before, and bonus points to those problems that require a whole new data set to be gathered


A major takeaway she learned along her journey was that foundational skills remain the same no matter which problems you are trying to solve


Part of the fun bits of the episode revealed some tips on what hiring managers are really looking for when interviewing candidates for data jobs


SPOILER: it's not about your technical skills

item.title: Highlights From My First Year As A Podcast Host
item.description:
To celebrate Season 2, my good friend Ramona asked if she could interview me and talk about all the things I did in 2023 with nerdnourishment


I was hesitant at first, not gonna lie, I actually don't really like talking about myself too much but when you own a company, you have to get used to that kind of stuff


So I said YES!!


Ramona did such a great job at hosting and had the best fun bits section we have had on the podcast yet üê±


There were a couple of origin stories:

- Ramona and I have our own combined origin story, and it includes Joe Reis

- The podcast has its own origin story involving me living out my childhood dreams, and includes Ken Jee


We also talked about my:

- Dancing background, hopefully will be able to produce more dance content this year

- Passion for teaching, mentoring, learning, and helping the data community

- Merch Store!


and... we nerded out a bit on Data Security and that you shouldn't even give Santa your address!


While this is a longer episode than usual, you will want to stay until the end because we share some heartfelt messages for the community and stories about what we are excited for in 2024 ü•≥


******

item.title: When Data Transforms You From Accountant to Youtuber | David Fortin
item.description:
Learn all about how an Excel Wizard uses data to solve the world's problems, one Flash Fill feature at a time.


David is on a mission to teach Excel in a fun and dynamic way


He left his corporate gig to go full time as a YouTube teacher


The best part about his teaching style, no fluff


His brand is the Piggy Bank Accountant

and sometimes he wears a pig hat, it is GREAT!!


Check out this episode as David shares his passion for teaching Excel tips, tricks, tutorials, hacks, formulas & functions


Stick around till the end to find out the best tip that saved him the most hours with Excel üò≤

item.title: Smashing Through Content So Fast You Become The Teacher | Richard Nero
item.description:
Learn all about how a Financial Systems Implementer uses data to solve the world's problems, one automated process at a time.


Richard's love for Excel, math, and automation came to him early as a child


He is very eager to learn, so much that he turned himself into the teacher


He hates seeing manual processes, and loves when he can show someone how to automate their job


But don't let automation scare you


Remember: AI's not going to replace you, someone using AI will probably replace you



Stick around for the Fun Bits here as Richard shares how he is turning kids into future data professionals


Aside from those that started crying on day 1, he loves to see them get into hyperfocus mode and build their first charts


He describes teaching kids to be the most rewarding experience!! ü§ì

item.title: How a Consultant Uses Data | Carlos Barboza
item.description:
Learn all about how a Consultant uses data to solve the world's problems, one trusted decision at a time.


A lot of us know that working with spreadsheets can be really hard work.


In this episode, Carlos gives a hilarious analogy of cleaning public bathrooms, ha!


Carlos has always been a fan of Excel and loves to share all kinds of tips and tricks with the community


The most shocking fact that he shared about Excel (shocking for some at least) was that there are companies out there making projections using only an Excel spreadsheeet which then is helping with all their business decisions üò≤

Carlos has always been a fan of Excel and loves to share all kinds of tips and tricks with the community


The most shocking fact that he shared about Excel (shocking for some at least) was that there are companies out there making projections using only an Excel spreadsheeet which then is helping with all their business decisions üò≤

item.title: How a Former Librarian Uses Data | Cheryl Cavelear
item.description:
Learn all about how a Former Librarian uses data to solve the world's problems, one usage statistic at a time.


This is an episode I have been wanting to have since I started this podcast in January üìñ


Cheryl and I got to deep dive into how cool librarians are and how much they use data, spoiler alert... it is A LOT!


Cheryl boiled it down to an analogy of when someone is looking for a book you are basically using an interface to query a database so therefore, you are using data!


One of the biggest problems that she solved as a librarian was related to usage statistics.


Figuring out what's getting used, how to tweak process to increase usage, and determining the return on money for books.


She also brings up the topic of being data driven vs making data informed decisions and why she sides with being data informed.

item.title: How a People Analyst Uses Data | Sonali Kumar
item.description:
Learn all about how a People Analyst uses data to solve the world's problems, one sales call at a time.


Sonali shares about why leaning transferable skills are the best way to get you into your next role.


She takes us through her whole journey, which really hones in on leveraging networking as a strategy to get a career, but she also emphsizes how important research is before you jump into a particular job so you know what you are getting yourself into.


BUT > don't do research to the point that you give yourself analysis paralysis üò¨


We also get to hear Sonali's self-pep-talks that if you are uncomfortable, if you are failing, that means you are learning and that is going to lead to success. She reminds us to be patient, the world will not fall apart, and everything is going to be ok.


Stay tuned to the end because the tips that Sonali shares on how NOT to learn things is invaluable!!

item.title: How The Techno Optimist Uses Data | Dan Everett
item.description:
Learn all about how The Techno Optimist uses data to solve the world's problems, one data parody at a time.


Have you experienced the transition from individual contributor to management or are maybe thinking about the transition one day?


Tune into this episode and Dan and I share about our experiences with the transition, what to expect, and why it's so dang hard.


In fact, according to research from CEB Global, 60% of new managers fail within the first 24 months in their new role.


Maybe that's because 85% of new managers do not get any training prior to becoming a manager!!

item.title: How a Product Strategist Uses Data | Ryan Dolley
item.description:
Learn all about how a Product Strategist uses data to solve the world's problems, one Marvel data viz at a time.


This episode should come with a warning label, super nerdy discussions coming your way!!


Ryan talks about the overlap of data science and business intelligence and how all data tools serve a specific purpose which should ultimately help all data professionals get their work done in the most efficient manner.


We talk about some data problems to solve that are unique, like the cold chain problem in both health and food. It was super fun to nerd out on solutions and talk about audit trails (one of my favorite topics, hehe).


Plus, we had two fun bits topics!!


ü¶∏üèª One for the Marvel fans out there as Ryan shares about spreadsheets and data visualizations he created as a kid based on his Marvel cards collection.


üé≤ Another for the tabletop roleplaying gamers out there as Ryan confesses how his passion for being a Dungeon Master was so strong that a couple of his friends had to drop out of college (don't worry, they are doing fine now).


Tune in to learn about how the love of these nerdy things like DnD really is very similar to the work of all data professionals, Ryan calls it 'data career training 101'.

item.title: How a Former Math Teacher Uses Data | Tiffany Teasley
item.description:
Learn all about how a Former Math Teacher uses data to solve the world's problems, one calculus math problem at a time.


Tiffany emphasized how you don't have to have a degree in math to get a data job.


It's actually all about the analytical thinking and problem solving skills.


Also, it helps a ton if you have great communication skills. You basically need to be able to explain things like you are explaining it to a 5 year old and your golden.


To help with these communication skills, specifically for when interviewing, Tiffany also shares about a new app that she has been building with AI around the STAR method ‚≠ê

item.description:

item.title: How a Data Architect Uses Data | Steven Pope
item.description:
Learn all about how a Data Architect uses data to solve the world's problems, one electric guitar at a time.


Steven talked about how learning about building a guitar is very much like learning about the tech industry.


If you are like me, you start out with the knowledge of what you can see as an outsider and then when you jump into the details then you find out there is hardware on the inside! I have only ever dealt with acoustic guitars, so this message really resonated with me.


We transitioned into talking about other types of guitars and I brought up a keytar, which I thought was as nerdy as it could get, but then Steve one upped me with Guitar Hero... what's nerdier than that?

item.title: How a PowerBI Consultant Uses Data | Becca Goodman
item.description:
Learn all about how a PowerBI Consultant uses data to solve the world's problems, one free resource at a time.


This is an empowering episode as Becca tells us how she transitioned from being a teacher into data, while also becoming a new mom.


She has always considered herself to be independent with learning and thinks solving things on your own is the best feeling.


One motto she learned as a teacher that helped her with her transition was to 'use data to drive instruction'.


You will not want to miss out on this episode as she shares the mindshift you have to make when talking with clients after being used to talking with 9 year olds and also how kids shows like Bluey share very powerful messages for adults.



LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/rebecca-goodman-o322/

Email: rgoodman@baich.com


Resources

- Datacamp: https://www.datacamp.com/

- Microsoft Trainings: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?products=power-bi&levels=beginner

- SQLBI: https://www.youtube.com/@SQLBI

- WiseOwl: https://www.wiseowl.co.uk/power-bi/exercises/power-bi-desktop/

- Measureup (PL-300 prep): https://www.measureup.com/microsoft-practice-test-pl-300-microsoft-power-bi-data-analyst.html

Catherine shares with us her workflow and approach to creating her Noir themed Excel stories in the age of AI.

You need to check this one out! üëÄ
